sc.fiji.snt.analysis

Class TreeAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.scijava.AbstractContextual
      • org.scijava.command.ContextCommand
        • sc.fiji.snt.analysis.TreeAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, org.scijava.Cancelable, org.scijava.command.Command, org.scijava.Contextual, org.scijava.plugin.SciJavaPlugin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PathOrderAnalysisCmd, RoiConverter, TreeStatistics

    public class TreeAnalyzer
extends org.scijava.command.ContextCommand
    Class for analysis of Trees
    Author:
    Tiago Ferreira

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeAnalyzer

        public TreeAnalyzer(Tree tree)
        Instantiates a new Tree analyzer.
        Parameters:
        tree - Collection of Paths to be analyzed. Note that null Paths are discarded. Also, when a Path has been fitted and Path.getUseFitted() is true, its fitted 'flavor' is used.
        See Also:
        getParsedTree()

    • Method Detail

      • restrictToSWCType

        public void restrictToSWCType(int... types)
        Restricts analysis to Paths sharing the specified SWC flag(s).
        Parameters:
        types - the allowed SWC flags (e.g., Path.SWC_AXON, etc.)

      • ignoreSWCType

        public void ignoreSWCType(int... types)
        Ignores Paths sharing the specified SWC flag(s).
        Parameters:
        types - the SWC flags to be ignored (e.g., Path.SWC_AXON, etc.)

      • restrictToOrder

        public void restrictToOrder(int... orders)
        Restricts analysis to Paths sharing the specified Path order(s).
        Parameters:
        orders - the allowed Path orders

      • restrictToSize

        public void restrictToSize(int minSize,
                           int maxSize)
        Restricts analysis to paths having the specified number of nodes.
        Parameters:
        minSize - the smallest number of nodes a path must have in order to be analyzed. Set it to -1 to disable minSize filtering
        maxSize - the largest number of nodes a path must have in order to be analyzed. Set it to -1 to disable maxSize filtering

      • restrictToLength

        public void restrictToLength(double lowerBound,
                             double upperBound)
        Restricts analysis to paths sharing the specified length range.
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - the smallest length a path must have in order to be analyzed. Set it to Double.NaN to disable lowerBound filtering
        upperBound - the largest length a path must have in order to be analyzed. Set it to Double.NaN to disable upperBound filtering

      • restrictToNamePattern

        public void restrictToNamePattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Restricts analysis to Paths containing the specified string in their name.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the string to search for

      • resetRestrictions

        public void resetRestrictions()
        Removes any filtering restrictions that may have been set. Once called, subsequent analysis will use all paths initially parsed by the constructor. Does nothing if no paths are currently being excluded from the analysis.

      • getParsedTree

        public Tree getParsedTree()
        Returns the set of parsed Paths.
        Returns:
        the set of paths currently being considered for analysis.
        See Also:
        resetRestrictions()

      • summarize

        public void summarize(boolean groupByType)
        Outputs a summary of the current analysis to the Analyzer table using the default Tree label.
        Parameters:
        groupByType - if true measurements are grouped by SWC-type flag
        See Also:
        run(), setTable(DefaultGenericTable)

      • summarize

        public void summarize(java.lang.String rowHeader,
                      boolean groupByType)
        Outputs a summary of the current analysis to the Analyzer table.
        Parameters:
        rowHeader - the String to be used as label for the summary
        groupByType - if true measurements are grouped by SWC-type flag
        See Also:
        run(), setTable(DefaultGenericTable)

      • getMetrics

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMetrics()
        Gets a list of supported metrics. Note that this list will only include commonly used metrics. For a complete list of supported metrics see getAllMetrics()
        Returns:
        the list of available metrics
        See Also:
        MultiTreeStatistics.getMetrics()

      • getAllMetrics

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllMetrics()
        Gets the list of all supported metrics.
        Returns:
        the list of available metrics
        See Also:
        MultiTreeStatistics.getAllMetrics()

      • getMetric

        public java.lang.Number getMetric(java.lang.String metric)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the specified metric.
        Parameters:
        metric - the metric to be computed (case insensitive). While it is expected to be an element of getMetrics(), it can be specified in a "loose" manner: If metric is not initially recognized, an heuristic will match it to the closest entry in the list of possible metrics. E.g., "# bps", "n junctions", will be both mapped to MultiTreeStatistics.N_BRANCH_POINTS. Details on the matching are printed to the Console when in debug mode.
        Returns:
        the computed value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if metric is not recognized
        See Also:
        getMetrics()

      • measure

        public void measure(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> metrics,
                    boolean groupByType)
        Measures this Tree, outputting the result to this Analyzer table using default row labels. If a Context has been specified, the table is updated. Otherwise, table contents are printed to Console.
        Parameters:
        metrics - the list of metrics to be computed. When null or an empty collection is specified, getMetrics() is used.
        groupByType - if false, metrics are computed to all branches in the Tree. If true, measurements will be split by SWC type annotations (axon, dendrite, etc.)

      • measure

        public void measure(java.lang.String rowHeader,
                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> metrics,
                    boolean groupByType)
        Measures this Tree, outputting the result to this Analyzer table. If a Context has been specified, the table is updated. Otherwise, table contents are printed to Console.
        Parameters:
        rowHeader - the row header label
        metrics - the list of metrics to be computed. When null or an empty collection is specified, getMetrics() is used.
        groupByType - if false, metrics are computed to all branches in the Tree. If true, measurements will be split by SWC type annotations (axon, dendrite, etc.)

      • getPrimaryPaths

        public java.util.Set<Path> getPrimaryPaths()
        Retrieves all the Paths in the analyzed Tree tagged as primary.
        Returns:
        the set of primary paths.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryBranches()

      • getPrimaryBranches

        public java.util.Set<Path> getPrimaryBranches()
        Retrieves the primary branches of the analyzed Tree. Primary branches (or root-associated) have origin in the Tree's root, extending to the closest branch/end-point. Note that a primary branch can also be terminal.
        Returns:
        the set containing the primary branches. Note that these branches (Path segments) will not carry any connectivity information.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryPaths(), StrahlerAnalyzer.getRootAssociatedBranches()

      • getTerminalBranches

        public java.util.Set<Path> getTerminalBranches()
        Retrieves the terminal branches of the analyzed Tree. A terminal branch corresponds to the section of a terminal Path between its last branch-point and its terminal point (tip). A terminal branch can also be primary.
        Returns:
        the set containing terminal branches. Note that as per Path.getSection(int, int), these branches will not carry any connectivity information.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryBranches(), restrictToOrder(int...)

      • getTips

        public java.util.Set<PointInImage> getTips()
        Gets the position of all the tips in the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the set of terminal points

      • getTips

        public java.util.Set<PointInImage> getTips(BrainAnnotation annot)
        Gets the position of all the tips in the analyzed tree associated with the specified annotation.
        Parameters:
        annot - the BrainAnnotation to be queried. Null not allowed.
        Returns:
        the branch points positions, or an empty set if no tips were retrieved.

      • getBranchPoints

        public java.util.Set<PointInImage> getBranchPoints()
        Gets the position of all the branch points in the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the branch points positions

      • getBranchPoints

        public java.util.Set<PointInImage> getBranchPoints(BrainAnnotation annot)
        Gets the position of all the branch points in the analyzed tree associated with the specified annotation.
        Parameters:
        annot - the BrainAnnotation to be queried.
        Returns:
        the branch points positions, or an empty set if no branch points were retrieved.

      • getCableLength

        public double getCableLength()
        Gets the cable length.
        Returns:
        the cable length of the tree

      • getCableLength

        public double getCableLength(BrainAnnotation compartment)
        Gets the cable length associated with the specified compartment (neuropil label).
        Parameters:
        compartment - the query compartment (null not allowed). All of its children will be considered
        Returns:
        the filtered cable length

      • getCableLength

        public double getCableLength(BrainAnnotation compartment,
                             boolean includeChildren)
        Gets the cable length associated with the specified compartment (neuropil label).
        Parameters:
        compartment - the query compartment (null not allowed)
        includeChildren - whether children of compartment should be included
        Returns:
        the filtered cable length

        public java.util.Set<BrainAnnotation> getAnnotations(int level)

      • getPrimaryLength

        public double getPrimaryLength()
        Gets the cable length of primary branches.
        Returns:
        the length sum of all primary branches
        See Also:
        getPrimaryBranches()

      • getTerminalLength

        public double getTerminalLength()
        Gets the cable length of terminal branches
        Returns:
        the length sum of all terminal branches
        See Also:
        getTerminalBranches()

      • getHighestPathOrder

        public int getHighestPathOrder()
        Gets the highest path order of the analyzed tree
        Returns:
        the highest Path order, or -1 if Paths in the Tree have no defined order
        See Also:
        getStrahlerNumber()

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether this tree is topologically valid, i.e., contains only one root and no loops.
        Returns:
        true, if Tree is valid, false otherwise

      • getStrahlerNumber

        public int getStrahlerNumber()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the highest Strahler number of the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the highest Strahler (root) number order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops

      • getStrahlerAnalyzer

        public StrahlerAnalyzer getStrahlerAnalyzer()
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the StrahlerAnalyzer instance associated with this analyzer
        Returns:
        the StrahlerAnalyzer instance associated with this analyzer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops

      • getStrahlerBifurcationRatio

        public double getStrahlerBifurcationRatio()
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the average Strahler bifurcation ratio of the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the average bifurcation ratio
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops

      • getNBranches

        public int getNBranches()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the number of branches in the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the number of branches
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops

      • getBranches

        public java.util.List<Path> getBranches()
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets all the branches in the analyzed tree. A branch is defined as the Path composed of all the nodes between two branching points or between one branching point and a termination point.
        Returns:
        the list of branches as Path objects.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops
        See Also:
        StrahlerAnalyzer.getBranches()

      • getAvgContraction

        public double getAvgContraction()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets average contraction for all the branches of the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the average branch contraction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops

      • getAvgBranchLength

        public double getAvgBranchLength()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets average length for all the branches of the analyzed tree.
        Returns:
        the average branch length
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tree contains multiple roots or loops
